column4: you can try reboot boot normally if the gui does not display try ctrl alt f1 to enter console mode
then login and run startx to start your gui
startx should be run as root
press ctrl alt f1 again to go to console
have a look at this http://www.techsupportforum.com/alternative-computing/linux-support/107839-ubuntu-loads-then-goes-blank-screen-bahhh.html
i can't open a web browser as i don't have a graphical interface :(
how are you chatting now
irssi, console-based irc client
w3m is console base browser
you dont need links you navigate with the arrows
try with w3m man there are no links there almost plain text
meaning i would have to remember your link, which is lost in the backlog now as i can't scroll up :p
ou
dont you have the mouse cursor there to copy it
nope, only a keyboard lol :/
hm nice console situation
ok it says after ctrl alt f1 when you get the login prompt
it's not even close to loading the display manager and x server
to configure your card to use the generic vesa drivers with commands like
dpkg --configure -a, dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, dpkg-reconfigure gdm, sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.backup, sudo vi /etc/X11/xorg.conf, this is for your xorg.conf
